uses: horrify is horrified at the thought of Geri moving in.
The very idea of this sort of thing would horrify the wimp establishment, both here and abroad.
horrify perfectly honest, if we had been Jesus in that situation, we would have been utterly horrified.
definition: To cause to feel horror: The citizens were horrified by the bombings. The guest was horrified at the rudeness of what he had said.
To cause unpleasant surprise to; shock: “I … passed a mirror … & was horrified at the shabbiness of my hat” ( Margaret Suckley )

To cause to feel extreme apprehension or unease; to cause to experience horror.
The haunted house was horrifying, from one room to the next I felt more and more like I wasn’t going to survive.
